comments.body: I am not aware of a L() format option. Did I miss anythin? https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/dev_guide/developing_modules_documenting.html#formatting-functions

Interesting. It has been around for some time: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/docs/bin/plugin_formatter.py#L80
I've seen that while working on some formatting problems, and assumed I could simply use it :-) (actually, I think I already used it in at least on of the `acme_*` before)
nice! (and uncool) that this is not documented (even though I could hardly found the docs)
Actually, when displaying the docs with `ansible-doc`, `L(...,...)` doesn't work. No idea how the man files behave (can't check right now).
It has been introduced in #37009, and it apparently was only meant (back then) for relative links.
@gundalow, since you introduced that feature: is it acceptable to also use it like in here (to link to external pages more nicely)?

diffHunk:

      L(the specification,https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-12#section-8).
      Also, consider the examples provided for this module."
   - "Although the defaults are chosen so that the module can be used with
